name: c-ares
description: A C library for asynchronous DNS resolution and name parsing, designed for high-performance networking applications. Provides non-blocking DNS queries with parallel request handling, making it ideal for event-loop driven systems and modern network stacks.
usage: Initialize resolver channel: ares_init(&channel); ares_gethostbyname(channel, "example.com", AF_INET, callback, NULL);
features: Asynchronous DNS: Non-blocking name resolution suitable for event loops
Multi-Thread Safe: Designed for concurrent use in threaded environments
Custom Nameservers: Programmatic control over DNS server configuration
DNSSEC Support: Optional validation of DNS records
Cross-Platform: Works on Linux/BSD/macOS/Windows/Embedded systems
Integration: Used by curl, Node.js, and other network-intensive applications
additional_resources: Official API documentation and libcurl integration examples

community_and_support.forums: GitHub Discussions and mailing list
community_and_support.GitHub: https://github.com/c-ares/c-ares

name: c-script
description: A lightweight embedded scripting language with C-like syntax, designed for runtime extensibility of applications. Combines simplicity of Lua with C semantics, offering direct memory access capabilities while maintaining sandboxed execution environments.
usage: Execute scripts: cscript -e 'printf("Hello World");'
features: C Syntax Familiarity: Supports pointers, structs, and preprocessor-like directives
Sandboxed Execution: Memory-safe runtime with configurable limits
FFI Support: Direct binding to host application functions
JIT Compilation: Optional just-in-time compilation for hot code paths
Cross-Platform: Runs on any system with ANSI C compiler
Embedding API: Simple integration into C/C++ applications
additional_resources: Language specification and embedding guide

community_and_support.forums: GitHub Issues and Discord community
community_and_support.GitHub: https://github.com/c-script/c-script

name: c-toxcore-static
description: Statically linked build of the Tox secure messaging protocol core library. Provides end-to-end encrypted peer-to-peer communication capabilities without dependencies, ideal for embedded systems and security-focused deployments.
usage: Link in applications: gcc -ltoxcore -static mytoxapp.c
features: Military-Grade Encryption: NaCl-based crypto primitives
Decentralized: No central servers or infrastructure required
Network Types: Supports TCP, UDP, and onion routing via Tor
Zero Dependencies: Fully self-contained build
Cross-Platform: ARM64-optimized with NEON acceleration
Protocol Features: File transfer, group chats, AV streaming
additional_resources: Tox Protocol Specification and API docs

community_and_support.forums: Tox Chat Matrix channel
community_and_support.GitHub: https://github.com/TokTok/tox-core

name: c-toxcore
description: Reference implementation of the Tox protocol - a secure, distributed messaging platform. Provides building blocks for creating privacy-focused chat applications with strong encryption and anti-censorship features.
usage: Initialize Tox instance: Tox *tox = tox_new(NULL, NULL);
features: P2P Architecture: Complete decentralization with DHT discovery
Forward Secrecy: Perfect forward secrecy in 1:1 chats
Portable Design: Works behind NATs and restrictive firewalls
Multi-Client Support: Simultaneous device connections
Community Tools: Python/JS bindings available
Logging: Configurable logging levels and handlers
additional_resources: Tox Developer Documentation and Client Guidelines

community_and_support.forums: Tox Development Forum
community_and_support.GitHub: https://github.com/TokTok/tox-core

name: ca-certificates-java
description: Mozilla's curated collection of Certificate Authority certificates packaged for Java applications. Maintains the cacerts truststore used by Java SSL implementations, ensuring up-to-date TLS certificate validation across JVM-based software.
usage: Update Java truststore: update-ca-certificates --fresh
features: Comprehensive Trust: 150+ root CAs from Mozilla's inclusion policy
Java Integration: Automatic update of $JAVA_HOME/lib/security/cacerts
CRL Support: Certificate Revocation List integration
Custom Trust: Ability to add/remove specific certificates
Security Compliance: Meets industry standards for PKI validation
additional_resources: Mozilla CA Certificate Policy documentation

community_and_support.forums: Debian Java Maintainers
community_and_support.GitHub: https://salsa.debian.org/java-team/ca-certificates-java

name: ca-certificates
description: The Debian-curated collection of Certificate Authority certificates for system-wide TLS trust. Includes root and intermediate certificates from major CAs, updated quarterly to reflect industry trust changes and security best practices.
usage: Update system certificates: update-ca-certificates
features: Global Trust: 250+ certificates from 150+ organizations
Auto-Update: Regular security updates via package manager
Local CAs: Ability to add custom enterprise certificates
CRL/OCSP: Support for revocation checking mechanisms
Format Support: PEM bundles for OpenSSL/GnuTLS compatibility
additional_resources: Debian CA Certificate Management Guide

community_and_support.forums: Debian Security Team
community_and_support.GitHub: https://salsa.debian.org/debian/ca-certificates

name: cabextract
description: A robust utility for extracting Microsoft Cabinet (CAB) archive files, supporting multi-volume cabinets, UTF-8 filenames, and advanced compression methods including LZX and Quantum. Essential for working with Windows installer packages and legacy software distributions.
usage: Extract cabinet: cabextract -F '*.dll' archive.cab
features: Multi-Volume: Handles split CAB archives seamlessly
Compression: Supports MSZIP, LZX, and Quantum algorithms
Filtering: Extract specific files using glob patterns
UTF-8: Proper handling of international filenames
Recovery: Partial extraction from damaged cabinets
Scripting: Exit codes for batch processing integration
additional_resources: Man pages with compression algorithm details

community_and_support.forums: GitHub Issues and Wine Project forums
community_and_support.GitHub: https://github.com/kyz/libmspack

name: caddy
description: A modern, extensible web server with automatic HTTPS, designed for simplicity and security. Combines HTTP/3 support, reverse proxying, and API gateway capabilities in a single static binary with zero-configuration TLS via Let's Encrypt.
usage: Start server: caddy run --config Caddyfile
features: Auto-HTTPS: Automatic TLS certificate management
HTTP/3: QUIC protocol support for low-latency delivery
Reverse Proxy: Load balancing and health checks
Extensible: Plugin architecture with 100+ official modules
Config API: Dynamic configuration via REST endpoints
Templating: Caddyfile supports environment variables
